nodes.text: RC-1262, nicknamed "Scorch," was a clone commando who served in the Galactic Republic's clone army as part of the elite unit Delta Squad. In 22 BBY, the squad recovered two killed Jedi from the planet Devaron following a massacre there orchestrated largely by Count Dooku's new Sith apprentice, Savage Opress. Delta Squad took the bodies to the Jedi temple on the planet Coruscant and reported to four Jedi High Council members there.

During the rise of the Galactic Empire, Scorch trained conscripted stormtroopers at an Imperial base on the planet Daro. After fellow clone commando CC-5576-39 "Gregor" was captured trying to desert the base, the rogue clone commando unit known as the "Bad Batch" infiltrated the base to free Gregor. Scorch encountered Gregor and his liberators and pursued them, being incapacitated when he fought the rogue commandos. He then joined Imperial troops on an LAAT/i gunship to capture the Bad Batch leader, "Hunter."
Biography
Clone Wars

RC-1262 was created on the planet Kamino as a clone of the bounty hunter Jango Fett to be part of the Galactic Republic's clone army. Nicknamed Scorch, he became a clone commando and part of commando unit Delta Squad during the Clone Wars between the Republic and the Separatist Alliance. At one point he and the rest of Delta Squad were dispatched into a conflict from a Republic gunship to seize a location of importance to them.

In 22 BBY, Delta Squad was deployed on a Nu-class attack/transport shuttle to the planet Devaron, where Jedi Master Halsey, his Padawan Knox and their clone troopers had been massacred by Separatist forces led by Count Dooku's new Sith apprentice, Savage Opress. The squad recovered the bodies of Halsey and Knox and transported them to the Jedi temple on the capital planet Coruscant. After landing, the commandos brought a coffins of the two dead Jedi, Scorch flanking the leader of Delta Squad, Clone Sergeant RC-1138 "Boss," who informed Jedi General Obi-Wan Kenobi and three other members of the Jedi High Council about how none of the Republic forces had survived the attack on Devaron.
Imperial Era

The Clone Wars ended in 19 BBY with the fall of the Separatists and the transition of the Republic into the Galactic Empire. The Empire sought to phase out the clone army and began growing a new conscripted stormtrooper army. On the planet Daro, Scorch and fifty other clone commandos were involved in training the first generation of the new stormtroopers at an Imperial base encased in a mountain. One of the commandos, CC-5576-39 "Gregor," decided to try and desert, but was quickly captured by the base's troops. Gregor, though, had activated a distress beacon, and Clone Force 99, a rogue clone commando unit better known as the "Bad Batch," was sent to rescue the imprisoned commando.

Three members of the Bad Batch, Sergeant "Hunter," "Tech" and CT-1409 "Echo," infiltrated the Imperial base and freed Gregor from his cell, soon alerting the Imperial forces there of his presence. Scorch and some stormtroopers went to a turbolift, only to find Gregor and the three infiltrators past the door. As the commando and his troops raised their blasters, Gregor and Hunter kicked Scorch back into the troopers and shut the lift door as the Imperials then fired on them. Scorch and two stormtroopers fired on the turbo lift as it descended.

Scorch and his stormtroopers continued to pursue Gregor and the infiltrators, who stunned many of the troopers along the way and utilized a smoke bomb to cover their retreat. To flank his targets, the commando took a shortcut and jumped across a moving lift. Scorch then ambushed Gregor and his liberators, shooting Gregor twice in his chestplate and attacking Tech. However, Hunter and Echo bombarded the commando with multiple stun shots, incapacitating him. After regaining consciousness, Scorch joined a complement of stormtroopers and two clone commandos on an LAAT/i gunship as Gregor and the Bad Batch attempted to escape on their Omicron-class attack shuttle, the Havoc Marauder. Hunter fell down the mountain, and the LAATs deployed Scorch and his troops to apprehend the rogue clone commando.
Personality and traits
As a clone of the human male bounty hunter Jango Fett, Scorch stood at 1.83 meters tall and had tan-colored skin.
Equipment
Scorch wore the standard armor of a clone commando with gray, white and yellow colors and a backpack. He wielded a DC-17m Interchangeable Weapon System and later a DC-15A blaster carbine.
Behind the scenes

RC-1262 first appeared in "Witches of the Mist," the fourteenth episode of the third season of Star Wars: The Clone Wars which aired on January 21 2011. He was identified as "Scorch" in the original episode guide for the episode, and as RC-1262 in the 2021 reference book Star Wars: The Clone Wars: Character Encyclopedia - Join the Battle!.
